summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 regarding follow-up on subpoena returns from AT&T for phone records. The correspondence involves law enforcement and prosecution personnel seeking subscriber information and checking if certain phone numbers are associated with Jeffrey Epstein or Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Byrne, Paul
persons.context: Copied on an email chain regarding subpoena returns for phone records in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Subpoena issued for phone records
events.description: A subpoena was issued, likely to AT&T, for phone records as part of the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: AT&T records received
events.description: Records from AT&T were received in response to the November 11 subpoena, but subscriber records were not included.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively pursuing phone record subpoenas related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation as of November 2021.
The email chain shows follow-up efforts to obtain subscriber information from AT&T that was not initially provided.
A specific request was made to check if certain phone tolls (calls) 'hit on any Epstein/Maxwell numbers', indicating an ongoing effort to map communications.
The correspondence involves multiple agencies, including the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
The document is external email correspondence marked as such, showing inter-agency communication regarding the investigation.
